justification: “Hotaling et al. (2019) analyzed these results using cumulative prospect theory (CPT …) to measure risk preference.”

measured_by: λ parameter of the MEM-EX model
justification: “The free parameter λ … determines the probability of making a value-assignment error for each item in memory.”

measured_by: κ parameter of the MEM-EX model
justification: “The individual randomly samples κ items from each memory store … In model fits, κ was constrained to integers from 1 to 8.”
construct: Memory sampling (number of items drawn from memory)

measured_by: ζ parameter of the MEM-EX model
justification: “If an outcome was highlighted, its weight was 1 + ζ, with ζ being a free parameter … Thus, perceptually highlighting an outcome increases its likelihood of being retrieved from memory.”

measured_by: ϕ parameter of the MEM-EX model
justification: “There is a probability, ϕ, that any given previously remembered outcome … is replaced by the currently sampled outcome.”

measured_by: β (ϐ) parameter of the MEM-EX model
justification: “ϐ is a free parameter … representing the amount of additional evidence required to overcome an individual’s default preference.”
construct: Risk bias (default preference toward risky or safe option)
